data.name: Open Rolling Stone
data.description: It is said ROLLING STONE and immediately evokes the Rock'n Roll, the great musical happenings, Woodstock, the Isle of White Festival, large groups and singers, starting right from the "Stones" via Richie Havens, Joan Baez, The Who, to name a few. Certainly musicians "peppery", and gritty ... here then that is dedicated to them, to the world of R & R and the prestigious magazine that has always been around the world, we Baladin we have created a version of "gritty" of our Open Baladin or the "OPEN ROLLING STONE". A beer where the freshness and the wise use of different types of pepper are combined with perfumes and Hops amaricato in a crescendo "music" really drink'n roll, which we are sure will gather around him a large group of "aficionados ".

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

breweries.name: Birrificia Le Baladin
breweries.description: It is the place where it all started. There would be much to say and tell it to start back over the key dates. In 1986, Teo decides, with his partner then Michelle, a pretty young French dancer, to open in Piozzo, a small town unknown to the door of the Langhe where he was born, a "creperie"! He rents a former "tavern" with an attached mini apartment on the top floor and a gravel courtyard on the back and opens its doors. At first, his passion for beer, and a little 'light his aversion for wine led him to fill the menu with more than two hundred references international beers, as well as dainties to enjoy to work alongside the crepes. Gradually, the goodness of the choices made ​​good name and port customers to small local baptized "Le Baladin" by his friend François of CIRQUE BIDON in homage to the nature of Teo same. Years went by and the room expands, you change, you will see a big circus tent to cover the courtyard paved with gravel now tables and chairs in style "Oktoberfest" and hand in hand also changes his mentor: Nora is now its new companion and muse together and decide a new course of the local : transform the creperie in a brewpub! After months of study and travel with Nora to discover Belgian brewers have our hero returns with huge bins loaded onto a van Volkswagen Westfalia and places them in the garage of the ousted former owner of the house, adjacent to the restaurant, now transformed into a microbrewery. So begins the adventure productive BEER BALADIN that sees just two beers "taxes" to the regulars who frequent the pub goers somewhat perplexed and embarrassed to taste these first, honestly a bit 'adventurous productions Teo. Over time, the production will be moved to other places for sizing issues and logistics, but still the aura of magic that permeated the early days of the brewery remains unchanged. Today, large kitchen has taken the place of the production and in the pub beers are on tap now classic carnet baladiniano as well as all production in the bottle. Occasionally a few small tweaks gives customers reason of surprise and veiled "Amarcord" in which one of them remembers the beginnings of this place, now a destination for "pilgrimage" by many fans of the beer world. It is always a place where good food is accompanied not only by our beers but by good music and by the sympathy of the staff who always has a smile for everyone and where it is customary to a friendly "welcome", a hello and a good day to all those who pass through it if only for a small beer refreshing.

breweries.description:
Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord. 

We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability. 

We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

breweries.name: Goose Island Beer Company
breweries.description:
When the first Goose Island Brewpub opened its doors in 1988, domestic, mass-produced beer was deeply ingrained in Midwestern culture. The craft beer industry was still in its infancy, with only a handful of brewpubs in existence in the Midwest. In his travels across Europe, beer-lover John Hall had enjoyed a distinctive local brew in each region he visited. Hall was convinced that Midwesterners could produce beers as good or better than those he’d tasted in his travels. Living on the shore of the largest system of fresh water on the planet Earth, in a city with rapidly evolving tastes – John decided that his hometown, Chicago, would be the ideal place to do just that.

The key to building interest in craft beer, Hall decided, was to allow consumers to watch the brewing process – while providing them with the then-novel experience of enjoying a wide variety of distinctive beers that had been produced on-site. Hall wanted to not only cater to his customers’ tastes, but to challenge them as well. Goose Island’s brewers set to work crafting a diverse selection of unique beers – and on Friday, May 13, 1988 the Goose Island Brewpub was born.

It turned out that John was right; Chicagoans palates evolved rapidly once Goose Island’s Brewpub opened its doors and introduced the city to distinctive craft beer. By 1995, the brewpub had become so popular that John Hall decided to open a larger brewery and bottling plant to keep up with demand. Finding still more room for growth, in 1999 Hall opened a second Goose Island Brewpub just a stone’s throw away from historic Wrigley Field.

Today, Goose Island continues to brew an innovative selection of over 50 craft beers at the brewpub, the best of which are then bottled at our Fulton Street brewery. Goose Island beers are now enjoyed in all 50 states and Europe.

breweries.name: Walkabout Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Walkabout Brewing Company was established in 1997 in Central Point, Oregon by founder and head brewer, Ross Litton. A native of Perth, Australia, Ross has been a resident of Oregon for 21 years.

Walkabout brews have traditionally been available primarily in Southern Oregon; however distribution has now been expanded to include all Oregon and Southern Washington. The beers can be found on draft in bars and restaurants and in bottles at stores and markets.

 Walkabout bottles Worker's Pale Ale, Jabberwocky Strong Ale and Point the Bone IPA in 22oz bottles. Walkabout is distributed by Point Blank Distributing in Portland, Bend and the Willamette Valley, Summit Distributing in Southern Oregon, Bigfoot Distributing on the Oregon coast and by Alpha Distributing in Washington State.

Walkabout products are brewed in a 7 barrel brew house in Medford, Oregon. The brewery is not only a manufacturing facility but houses a tasting room with a large patio and outdoor area, dock sales are available.

breweries.name: The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company was established by college friends Eliot Butler and Rob LoBreglio. The two dreamed of starting a Brewpub that offered many varieties of house-brewed ales and lagers and hearty made-from-scratch pub fare to accompany the beers. The original Downtown location opened in November 1994 and expanded with the addition of a pool hall in 1996. The wild success of the first Great Dane led to the decision to open more pubs in the Madison area.

The Fitchburg Great Dane began operations in 2002 and the Hilldale pub followed in 2006. In 2009, the Hilldale pub expanded its brewery and opened a 4,000 square foot pool hall. Additionally, in May of 2009, the first Great Dane outside of the Madison area debuted in Wausau, Wisconsin. The Wausau Great Dane added a 100 seat beer garden and outdoor bar in the spring of 2011. In November 2010, the fifth Great Dane began operations in Grandview commons, off of Cottage Grove Road on Madison's east side.

breweries.name: Mountain Goat
breweries.description:
Dave and Cam learned to be persistent. Really persistent. They finally secured the required funds from friends, family and a business banker who wanted them out of his face.

Today the boys operate their very own microbrewery in Richmond (inner Melbourne). They craft the Hightail Ale, Organic Steam Ale plus seasonal beers in longnecks like the Surefoot Stout , IPA and Double Hightail.

“The plant is very labor intensive, but we can squeeze great beer out of it” says Dave. “And after hand filling, capping and labelling just on 2 million bottles you can well imagine we’re pretty happy about putting in a small, automated bottling line.”

Mountain Goat has collected a swag of awards over the years for their traditional, all natural ales and now has about 80 bars in Melbourne pouring their beers on tap plus bottled beer distributed nationally.

So why Mountain Goat? Well, a mountain goat’s a big hairy animal that’s never gonna fall over.

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

breweries.name: brewLAB
breweries.description:
brewLAB is Rob, Peter, Steve and the love of brewing beer. We are an artisinal nano-brewery in the city of Carpinteria, CA that focuses on creating small batch beers with an experimental approach. Rob and Steve met in 1999 and brewed their first batch of beer together in 2008. While attending UCSB, Rob met Peter while visiting Orella Ranch in Gaviota and they began brewing beer together in the Santa Barbara area. Then, in the summer of 2011, the three of them converged for a backpacking trip (pictured above) on The Lost Coast of Northern California - it was on this trip that they first discussed starting a brewery together. In late 2012 after some serious brainstorming and long meetings, the initiative had begun and planning was underway.
 
It is vitally important to us that we are directly involved with the production of our raw materials.  We are growing our own hops in the Santa Barbara area to supplement our usage, and in the future we plan to be growing enough to supply hops to the local community.  Our grains will be grown in the Santa Ynez Valley and malted right here in Santa Barbara.  All of our solid waste (spent grains, hops, yeast) will be fed to local pigs, local cricket farmers, or composted .  We will participate in, and contribute to, local festivals and events that revolve around brewing, environmentalism, and the promotion of local businesses.

data.name: Revelation Ale
data.description: Our flagship brew, born out of a comedy of errors. First, Rob added homegrown Cascade, Simcoe and Citra hops at precisely the wrong time. Then Norm went rogue and threw in a little unintended chocolate malt. Dark and rich, yet surprising light on your palate, this English-style IPA starts with the goodness of Maris Otter English barley and finishes citrusy with aromas of grapefruit. What you taste is not what you expect, and that’s what makes it such a great revelation.

breweries.name: Aquanaut Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Aquanaut Brewing Company is the creation of brewer and graphic artist, Eric McNeil. In 2006, Eric McNeil moved to Chicago where he brewed his first beer in his apartment on Addison Street. Eight years later, with the help and partnership of Philip Tadros of Doejo, LLC, Aquanaut Brewing Co. was formed and found its home in the Bomanville/Edgewater neighborhood.

We are dedicated to the entire package, inside and out. We produce fresh, locally brewed beers that have a seasonal flair; beers that are engaging to the palate while complimenting a wide range of foods. In embracing the entire craft, we have gained attention by concocting distinctive beer styles wrapped in original label art. We are passionate about producing well-balanced beers that are an exclusive example of that style

data.name: Ricky's IPA
data.description: IPA stands for Indian Pale Ale and has its origins in the export of beer from England to India. For over 100 years ago Englishmen realized that the beer they shipped to India could be bad before it arrived. They then set up more hops and delivered it with a higher alcohol content than the original product, to improve sustainability. Ricky's IPA is a Northern IPA brewed in the same way, but with a little less hops content than IPAn had 100 years ago. Ricky's IPA is torrhumlad in order to obtain all hints of hops.
data.foodPairings: Ricky's IPA fits anyone who is looking for a traditional IPA. Should you serve it to food makes you the best to all kinds of meats. Preferably with a gräddbaserad sauce.

breweries.name: Zeunerts
breweries.description:
About Zeunerts Craft Beer

BAVARIAN BEER CULTURE AND NORTHERN SWEDISH CHARACTERISTICS

This is precisely what Zeunerts is. A combination that guarantees high quality. It is quality that is the basis of Zeunerts’ business. The Bavarian art of brewing is without a doubt the finest in the world. As early as 1859, Christoffer August Zeunert introduced copper vats and open fermenting tubs in production and the tradition of ageing the beer to the perfect maturity and flavour. It goes without saying that we follow the German Beer Purity Laws.

 ONLY FIRST-CLASS RAW MATERIALS WILL DO HERE

We are extremely careful about raw materials. The water, the most important prerequisite for a good beer, gives us a strong advantage in quality. The fresh water of the Swedish North is the best water from which to make beer. At least that was the opinion of Christoffer August Zeunert. Hops are the spice of beer. The little hop cones contain the hundreds of flavours that give beer its bitterness, flavour and aroma. All hop varieties are carefully selected to suit their particular type of brew.

breweries.name: Great American Restaurants
breweries.description:
In 1974, Randy Norton and Jim Farley opened a 16 table pizza place in Fairfax City, VA. Mike Ranney joined them a year later, and with the opening of Fantastic Fritzbe’s Flying Food Factory (now Silverado) in 1976, Great American Restaurants was born. Over the past 36 years, their partnership has thrived as a result of their entrepreneurial spirit, enthusiasm for hospitality, and a ton of hard work by thousands of the best team players in the industry.

“GAR is fun because our people take pride in being part of something special and love what we do. Our restaurants are filled with guests and staff that want to have a good time. GAR helps everyone feel great. GAR cares about our people on a whole different level than anyone else… and is also obsessive about the details. A unique combination.”

data.name: Rogue Trail India Ale
data.description: This is our signature brew, named for our slogan, “Don’t fear the Barrel Hopped beer.” We brew our IPA with true to form European ingredients, with over 2lbs of hops per barrel! Then we rack that beer over to a local wine barrel where we age it with some more hops in the oak. Traditionally the IPA was brewed to last the long voyage in oak barrels aboard ships from England to India.

data.name: Rousal IPA
data.description: We have brewed this IPA mainly for out love of hops of all kinds. One of the best ways to create a combination of bitterness, taste and aroma it to keep "hopping" the beer through the entire brewing process. This is exactly what we have done with this beer, from the mash and wort all the way to the fermentation. We have also cooked some of the hops sous-vide to keep most of the oils in the hops intact.

breweries.name: Goose Island Beer Company
breweries.description:
When the first Goose Island Brewpub opened its doors in 1988, domestic, mass-produced beer was deeply ingrained in Midwestern culture. The craft beer industry was still in its infancy, with only a handful of brewpubs in existence in the Midwest. In his travels across Europe, beer-lover John Hall had enjoyed a distinctive local brew in each region he visited. Hall was convinced that Midwesterners could produce beers as good or better than those he’d tasted in his travels. Living on the shore of the largest system of fresh water on the planet Earth, in a city with rapidly evolving tastes – John decided that his hometown, Chicago, would be the ideal place to do just that.

The key to building interest in craft beer, Hall decided, was to allow consumers to watch the brewing process – while providing them with the then-novel experience of enjoying a wide variety of distinctive beers that had been produced on-site. Hall wanted to not only cater to his customers’ tastes, but to challenge them as well. Goose Island’s brewers set to work crafting a diverse selection of unique beers – and on Friday, May 13, 1988 the Goose Island Brewpub was born.

It turned out that John was right; Chicagoans palates evolved rapidly once Goose Island’s Brewpub opened its doors and introduced the city to distinctive craft beer. By 1995, the brewpub had become so popular that John Hall decided to open a larger brewery and bottling plant to keep up with demand. Finding still more room for growth, in 1999 Hall opened a second Goose Island Brewpub just a stone’s throw away from historic Wrigley Field.

Today, Goose Island continues to brew an innovative selection of over 50 craft beers at the brewpub, the best of which are then bottled at our Fulton Street brewery. Goose Island beers are now enjoyed in all 50 states and Europe.

data.name: Rye Baby
data.description: Rye Baby IPA ain’t for no squares! Brewed with floor malted English Marris Otter and a hefty charge of rye malts, this beer brings a spicy malt presence to the scene. But its the hops that are the stars of this hep ale. We hopped Rye Baby with copious amounts of Chinook and Simcoe hops and then dryhopped it with a blend of the two to give it an amazing hop character that will make you the baddest delinquent in Baltimore! We think Rye Baby is a delicious beer that you’ll be burning inside to drink, and if that’s a crime we’ll stand convicted!

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

breweries.name: Sequoia Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sequoia Brewing Company Bar & Grill was started in October
of 2003 by Scott and Michele Kendall who purchased Butterfield Brewing Company in February 2000. Butterfield's started in the Spring of 1989 with award winning Brewmaster Kevin Cox in the heart of the historical Tower District, Fresno, California. The Micro Brewing Company and Restaurant is known as a neighborhood icon in Fresno. Scott and Michele changed the name to wholesale their beer throughout the United States.

Kevin continued on as Sequoia's Brewmaster, putting together a creative mix of 11 unique ales and lagers on tap brewed with the finest ingredients including monthly special beers, wines, specialty drinks, and their homemade Root Beer. Recently, Rick Bouke took over as Brewmaster, and is responsible for the high quality and craft beer character our customers have come to expect. Sequoia's menu offers great food with the freshest ingredients, serves Certified Angus Beef, prepares their sauces and items from scratch and offers fresh daily fish.

Sequoia offers a menu for all ages in a warm and comfortable atmosphere, where everyone knows your name. Sequoia is a hot spot for live music featuring the best local bands and a private party room. A second location with a mountain lodge atmosphere, rock fireplace and a patio was opened in Northeast Fresno in July of 2005 at Piazza del Fiore. Along with the same great beers on tap, there is a full bar at the Champlain location.

breweries.name: Sigtuna Brygghus
breweries.description:
Sigtuna Brygghus arrived in 2005 at ölentusiasterna Peter Forss ', David Meadows ' and Dan Lundgren's initiative. With their history as leading personalities since the 1980s behind the new Swedish ölboomen project was a unique experience.

Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer was originally the luxurious new interpretations of historical ölstilar and they made quick success. The small-budgeted production was exceeded after only one year.

With inspiration from American craft beer a la New York and Boston was launched, among others, the East River and East Coast Pale Ale, which in a short time have become bestsellers in Sweden with microbrewery standards.

From 2009 to 2011, when the brewery with the help of partner Galateas investment could be expanded, sexdubblades sales. Sigtuna Brygghus sped up as one of the biggest brands in Swedish hantverksöl.

The product portfolio, with both delightfully flavorful session beer that exciting experimentbrygder, has made itself a reputation internationally and in several exhibitions. Not least through many awards at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival in recent years.

In the fixed range includes 3 stock and ale, all available at Systembolaget. Each year brewed a wide selection of seasonal and specialty beers, which won prizes and a warm reception.

Discover Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer so you can understand why.

data.name: Shepherd Neame India Pale Ale
data.description:
Hailing from the tradition of 18th Century IPAs, which relied on generous hopping to protect exports during arduous journeys, this modern incarnation retains the strength, body and strong hop character which is synonymous with this beer’s provenance.

A glorious showcase of the distinct, heavily hopped beers for which Shepherd Neame is famed, India Pale Ale delivers potent bitterness, offset with generous amounts of pale ale malt to deliver a balanced, yet uncompromising brew.

data.name: Silverspot IPA
data.description:
Drink a beer, save a butterfly!

Silverspot IPA holds a permanent slot in the Pelican lineup with its brilliant gold color and assertively complex hop aroma. Brew Master Darron Welch selected the blend of Sterling, Fuggle and Meridian hops, focusing on herbal, floral, spicy and tangerine-like characters to create this highly drinkable 6% abv English-Style IPA.

Silverspot IPA celebrates the Oregon Silverspot butterfly which once flourished in coastal grasslands from Washington to California. Due to habitat loss, this threatened butterfly is now found only in a handful of protected areas. The Oregon Coast is home to most of these sites including nearby Mt. Hebo and Cascade Head, which can be seen from the patio of the Pelican Pub & Brewery. Oregon Silverspot butterflies depend on a unique ecosystem of coastal grasslands, with caterpillars feeding on violet leaves and butterflies drinking the nectar of flowering plants. A collaborative habitat restoration and reintroduction program is helping to increase this butterfly population. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this beer will help fund conservation efforts for the Oregon Silverspot Butterfly.

Welcome to the Pelican Pub Brew House. Darron Welch is the Brew Master here at the Pub. Before becoming the Brew Master, Darron was an assistant brewer for Adler Brau Brewery in Appleton, Wisconsin, but before that, he home brewed for many years in his hometown of Eugene, Oregon.

Darron was a key player in the creation of the Pelican Pub Brewery. He helped build the Pelican Pub from the ground up, designing the brewery layout and production flow as well as all of the fine Pelican beers.

breweries.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
breweries.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

data.name: Spud Boys IPA
data.description:
Spud Boy's IPA is Mostly an English Style IPA, clocking in at a relatively low 65 IBU's
allowing it's malt character to hold it's own against the delicate English hops. It is a hybrid,
though, because of the noticeable amount of the all-American Cascade hop, added late in the boil,
gives it a small dose of pine/citrus/grapefruit for complexity. Spud Boy was Jerry Garcia's
nick name in the short lived bluegrass band, Old & In the Way, in which he played banjo.

data.name: Staple English IPA
data.description: Every brewery nowadays must have an IPA of sorts. Just like peanut butter and jelly in the pantry, an IPA is a staple. This IPA is true to the style guidelines for an English Style IPA. This is not a bitter bomb, hopagedon type IPA. This beer has a healthy dose of several varieties of hops. However, we do it in a balanced fashion so the grist bill comes through just as well as the hops. Our house ale yeast to provides the balance in hop aroma and yeast esters.

breweries.name: Grist Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.

Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.

While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.

breweries.name: Brenner Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Brenner Brewing Co. is a microbrewery in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Founder, Mike Brenner was awarded the title Master Brewer after completing a rigorous international training program at the Siebel Institute and the Doemens Akademie. Every aspect of the brewery includes the founders lifelong commitment to supporting local art and music.

Brenner's passion for crafting delicious beer and his lifelong devotion to Milwaukee's arts and music scene, has led to the creation of Brenner Brewing's "12 Ounce Ambassadors." Each style of beer features the artwork of a local artist and comes with a soundtrack featuring the music of local bands. As Brenner Brewing's distribution expands so does the awareness of Milwaukee's incredible arts scene.

Brenner also opened a 25,000 sq ft arts incubator in the building with the brewery which features a 2,000 sq ft contemporary art gallery and 20 artists' studio spaces. Come visit the brewery, tasting room, and art gallery soon.

data.name: Star of Eastbourne
data.description:
Star of Eastbourne is a strong, old style India Pale Ale reminiscent of the ales exported across the globe by British breweries during the early 19th Century. 

Tasting notes: A full hop aroma, golden body and tight head. The bitterness lingers on the palate giving a dry finish.

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

data.name: Stoppage Time
data.description:
Our English IPA is a nod to the classic style. Though some may argue like football, its bolder American cousin has improved on the classic. We feel there is no reason not to enjoy both styles for what they bring to the table.

Brewed with English malts and hops, and oak aged just like they used to across the pond.

breweries.name: Oval Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Oval Brewing is a start-up commercial brewery and tap-room, once open it will operate as a “social brewery” in Columbus, Ohio. It will be a production facility producing kegs and cans of craft beer for the local market. Attached to the brewery will be a tasting room where patrons can interact with the brewers, hang out, learn and -of course- taste.

OBC will have various social functions beyond creating excellent beer; the brewery space will be available as an event space for both public and private functions, a small entertainment venue, team building events, home-brewing classes and team-building workshops. We are also creating a “virtual boardroom” where customers can vote on upcoming beers and styles. These pieces will allow us to communicate directly with the our customers and community.

breweries.name: Chapman's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Chapman's Brewing Company is here because you care about what you drink. Everything we do, from working with orchards in Michigan and Washington to the selection of cans instead of bottles is completely focused on making the highest quality beers and ciders in the Midwest. Please come see us at the brewery in Angola – any Chapman’s employee you meet will also be an owner of the company and wants to hear what you think of our craft.

data.name: Sunrise IPA
data.description: IMPORTANT – this IS NOT a West Coast IPA. This beer is styled after the more traditional English IPA’s. The huge alcohol and aggressive hopping is not present. The color of Sunrise is deep orange; the nose is malty and woody with just a hint of aroma hops. The pallet is earthy and sweet with oak and finally finishes with a grassy spicy bitterness of hops. We use French Oak in the fermentation process that lends a different character to the finished beer. Sunrise is an American salute to our British heritage and is an opportunity to experience a taste of the old world.

breweries.name: American River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
NESTLED near the American River in Rancho Cordova, CA and located in a revitalized warehouse along Trade Center Drive is American River Brewing Company.

The dream-come-true of founder/brewer David Mathis and Head Brewer Andy Armstrong, American River Brewing Company encompasses the life-long passions of beer and the art/science of brewing.

Plans for the brewery began in 2010. After more than 15 years in the commercial brewing industry, we embarked on locating a useable location to house a production level brewery that would include a tasting room and space to grow. After an exhaustive search a home was found and construction began in the summer of 2011.

The original scope called for a modest 7 bbl brew house with tanks enough to manage 2000 bbl of production per year. After much re-thinking and soul-searching the brewery was increased in size to 15 bbl and room to grow to 10,000 bbls production per year. By October 2011, we started to formulate the first recipes.
